Headers

The first basic element of your site or application is the header. There are two main styles of header: a branded header and an unbranded header. The unbranded header is an option for internal applications where branding seems unnecessary.

Responsive Behavior

When viewed on a mobile device, any top navigation items will collapse into a menu icon that will appear in the header.

Global Search

All headers shown here include Global Search functionality. Within UXFrame, additional variants without Global Search are supported.

Example

${require('html-loader?interpolate!../../partials/toggles.html')}

Branded Header

The branded header has the John Deere logo on the left and the application title and global search on the right. There are three variations of the header: Two contain an application title; one is a header without an application title.

Skip to main content

Unbranded Header

The unbranded header is only suitable for internal, 3rd party applications where customization is limited.

Skip to main content

User eXperience

Action Another action Something else here

Guidelines

  • Maintain the distance and proportion between the John Deere logo and vertical brand bar as seen above.
  • Never resize the John Deere logo or brand bar from provided image and code.
  • Always use the flat 2 color John Deere logo without the gradient, as provided here.
  • Please consult with the UX team if any special circumstances regarding our brand arise.
  • Remove the search icon from the header if there is no global search functionality
  • Use a dropdown on the username only when there are more options than Sign Out, such as Preferences and Help.
  • Use only first name for the displayed username. Full names can be displayed inside the expanded dropdown.

Documentation

Modifiers

Class Description
.uxf-header-unbranded add class to div.uxf-header element and make the necessary HTML changes as shown above to apply unbranded header styles
.uxf-header-no-user add class to div.uxf-header element and remove div structure that creates user dropdown to apply styles for header title with no user information
.uxf-user-name add <a href="">Sign Out</a> after Hi, <span class=" uxf-user-name">First Name</span> if Sign Out is the only option

To remove the search functionality from your header, remove all code between button.uxf-btn-search.navbar-toggle and div.uxf-header-title.pull-right for branded headers or all code after button.uxf-header- button.navbar-toggle for unbranded headers.

Javascript

The header component uses custom javascript included within UXFrame Plus for the search box and the Bootstrap Collapse component to include the navbar within the header on smaller devices.

Convert from UXFrame v1 to v2 with .uxf-2018 Class

All Headers
  1. Remove div.wrapper-container
  2. Remove div.brandbar-top
  3. Remove div.brandbar-bottom
  4. Change div .header to div .uxf-header
  5. Change div .logo to div .uxf-logo and move directly after div.uxf-header
  6. Surround h1 with div.uxf-header-title.pull-right.hidden-xs
Headers with User Dropdowns
  1. Move div.dropdown-container.user-info-style directly after the h1 element inside div.uxf-header-title
  2. Remove div.dropdown that surrounds span.user-name
  3. Remove div.dropdown-menu that surrounds ul.thin-list
  4. Change .dropdown-container.user-info-style to .uxf-user-info.visible-lg.visible-md
  5. Change span .user-name to span .dropdown.dropdown-inline
  6. Change ul .thin-list to ul .dropdown-menu
  7. Change li .user-name to .dropdown-user-name.dropdown-menu-right
  8. Change li .user-title to .dropdown-user-title
  9. Add a.dropdown-toggle[data-toggle="dropdown"] surrounding user name text inside span.dropdown.dropdown-inline
  10. Add a space and span.caret after user name text
Headers with Inline User Info (no dropdown)
  1. Move div.user-info directly after the h1 element inside div.uxf-header-title
  2. Remove div.user-salutation that surrounds span.salutation
  3. Remove span.salutation that surrounds span.user-name
  4. Change div.user-info to div.uxf-user-info
  5. Change span.user-name to span.uxf-user-name
Headers without User Info
  1. Remove .no-user class from h1
  2. Add .uxf-header-no-user to .uxf-header element
